references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This paper demonstrates that diffusion models surpass GANs in image generation quality, providing a strong foundation for the current generation models used in this work.
This foundational paper introduces the Variational Autoencoder (VAE), a generative model that plays a crucial role in many subsequent generative models, including those related to this work.
This seminal work introduces Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a highly influential class of generative models that laid groundwork for many later advances in image generation.
This paper presents significant improvements to training GANs, addressing instability issues and thereby greatly advancing their applicability to complex image generation tasks.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling through stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This work introduces a novel approach to generative modeling using stochastic differential equations and score functions, forming the theoretical basis for many score-based diffusion models, which are critical to this paper's advancement.
